titleStmt.title: M. W. Smith et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6041

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency the Govnor of Ky

The undersigned M W Smith states that in year 1855, he caused a warrant of arrest to issue James Burnett, Tillman Tuttle, & Clinton Tuttle from the office of S Head Justice of the Peace for Wayne, and said parties were brought before said Head for trial soon thereafter, a jury was impannelled, and under the erroneus instructions of said justice of the peace said jury returned a verdict in the trial of said warrant against your petitioner assessing a fine against him of Fifteen dollars, and thereupon a judgment was enacted against him for $15, and costs,

He states that no process had been issued against him and he was not before said Court
for trial, and he was guilty of no infraction of the law.
He asks your Excellency to remit said fine so erroneously assessed against him, the justice before whom said warrant was tried threatens to proceed to the collection of the same by Execution,

R M Tate
N. B. Sloam
J. R. Wilhite
W. Simpson
H W Tuttle
M P Sallee
Wm Bartleson

Wayne County
vs
M W Smith
Petition
$15 --
Refused
